messages.subject: Premiere: HEM-NewsBriefs
messages.msgSnippet: Dear Friends, This is the premiere (below) of a new weekly online newsbrief from the publishers of Home Education Magazine. This newsbrief is specifically
messages.messageBody:
Dear Friends,

This is the premiere (below) of a new weekly online newsbrief from the
publishers of Home Education Magazine. This newsbrief is specifically
produced for homeschooling support group leaders, newsletter editors,
website managers and others who work with homeschoolers in an information
sharing or networking capacity. Our goal is to provide a reliable source of
timely news, press releases, announcements, resources and encouragement for
the people who work for homeschooling families.

To subscribe to HEM-NewsBriefs send a blank emailing to
HEM-NewsBriefs-subscribe@onelist.com or visit:
http://www.onelist.com/community/HEM-NewsBriefs

We welcome feedback and suggestions for future briefs. Please address your
email to Helen Hegener, Editor mailto:HEM-Editor@...

Please also feel free to forward this free newsbrief to any friends or
colleagues who may be interested.

Helen Hegener, Publisher
HEM-NewsBriefs
HEM-Editor@...
http://www.home-ed-magazine.com

............ ............ ............ ............ ............
............ ............ ............ ............ ............
............ ............ ............ ............ ............
............ - - - HEM-NewsBriefs - - -
- - - March 13 - - -

A free weekly email newsbrief from the publishers of Home Education Magazine!

The Spring issue of the National Home Education Network's journal, Voices,
is now available:
http://www.nhen.org

The world's largest library of electronic books:
http://www.netlibrary.com/

Got a question about copyrights? The U.S. Copyright Office has answers:
http://lcweb.loc.gov/copyright/

An excellent perspective on the commercialization of AOL and how it has
affected homeschoolers: http://www.blueear.com/index1.html.

Looking for a source of conference display materials? Check out Trade Show
Supply:
http://www.tradeshowsupply.com

Michael Moy's timely newslinks on homeschooling-related articles in the
mainstream media can be read from his website:
http://www.geocities.com/mmoy/hsitn.html

Building your own website? Webmonkey provides tutorials from the basics to
advanced levels:
http://www.hotwired.lycos.com/webmonkey

HEM's Older Kids columnist Cafi Cohen has an article in the March/April
issue of Mothering magazine:
http://www.mothering.com/toc.htm

Carpe Librum, Coeme Librum, Lege Librum, Vende Librum. (Seize the Book, Buy
the Book, Read the Book, Sell the Book.) -Inscribed on a pillar at Powell's
Books, Portland, Oregon:
http://www.powellsbooks.com

Subscribe to HEM-NewsBriefs: A free weekly emailed newsbrief from the
publishers of Home Education Magazine. Send a blank emailing to
HEM-NewsBriefs-subscribe@onelist.com or visit:
http://www.onelist.com/community/HEM-NewsBriefs

Helen Hegener, Publisher
Home Education Magazine/HEM-NewsBriefs
